Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2010 03:38PM survivorcat wrote: I don't post very much either, but I read this board every day.  As it's been said in earlier posts, I appreciate all of the knowledge and comradarie on these boards.  The world has certainly become a much smaller place thanks to the internet, and even though our members are so spread apart by miles and oceans, it is like living right next door to your best friend who can offer good advice or maybe just a shoulder to cry on.  I offer my thanks as well.
Posts.Title: To the wonderful ladies on this board... RobinWendy vickib

Posts.Content: survivorcat wrote: I am coming up to 5 years on Tamoxifen in October and have noticed some changes lately.  During the entire time I have been on it my fingernails have been chipping off in layers and breaking easily so I've had to keep them short.  Over the last month or so my nails have suddenly become very strong and have now grown so long I have trouble typing since I'm not used to them.  I am also now getting hot flashes every night which I haven't had in a number of years.  Did anyone have this kind of change when tamoxifen stopped working?  I know my onc is taking me off it in October, but I am thinking that maybe I should try and see her sooner to discuss a switch in meds now. Cath Dx 1/8/1991, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen losing it's effect? survivorcat mohonda

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2010 11:47PM survivorcat wrote: January will be 10 years for me!  I had FAC chemo and radiation for the first 3 months but have been on hormonals only ever since (along with bonefos followed by pamidronate).  My mets were to sternum, rib and lungs.  I continue to dance with the stable boy.
